Bug.Summery: config[] array doesnt contain the OS environment vars
Bug.WithStack:
According to: http://www.eclipse.org/birt/phoenix/ref/rom/structs/ConfigVar.html
The config[] array should hold enviroment vars.
I set Deployment=test as a system environment variable in XP, fired up eclipse with birt, and tried us use the following in the data source property binding for URL:
if (config["Deployment"]=="test") {"jdbc:oracle:thin:@test:1521:db"; } else {"jdbc:oracle:thin:@live:1521:db"; }
This throws an exception that config["Deployment"] doesnt exist.
I also tried setting Deployment as a -D parameter in the eclipse startup short cust as follows:
"C:\Program Files\eclipse311\eclipse.exe" -vmargs -Xmx512M -DDeployment=test
and also
"C:\Program Files\eclipse311\eclipse.exe" -vmargs -Xmx512M -DDeployment.test (this is how it was documented in one example)
This did not help.
How do we get Birt to switch DB based on the environment? It needs to be supported by Engine.
Fixed!

Bug.Summery: Thickness of cell borders: Difference in design and production

Lines.Line: 1. Please correct this, the result thickness should be same as design thickness
2. It would be better to offer not graphical options to choose, but values and units e.g. value 1, unit pixel like in other property boxes
Created attachment 36050
Design and production impression of cell border thickness

In CSS specification, it doesn't define the width of thin, medium and thick, the only requirement is 'thin' <= 'midium' <= 'thick'. The absolut value depends on the user agents. IE implements the 'thin' as 2 px while MOZILLA implements it as 1 px.

Bug.WithStack:
Hello,
I created a simple report which shows just a table. I wanted to modify the thickness of a cell's border. In the designer one can choose only a graphical value (a thin line, a normal line and a thick line) I choosed the thine one, in the designer the cell has a thin border (1px) but if I run the report the cell's border is 2px. (see attachment birt.jpg)
1. Please correct this, the result thickness should be same as design thickness 2. It would be better to offer not graphical options to choose, but values and units e.g. value 1, unit pixel like in other property boxes Created attachment 36050 Design and production impression of cell border thickness In CSS specification, it doesn't define the width of thin, medium and thick, the only requirement is 'thin' <= 'midium' <= 'thick'. The absolut value depends on the user agents. IE implements the 'thin' as 2 px while MOZILLA implements it as 1 px.
The user can specify the border-with to '1px' to get the exactly 1px width border. That's not the problem of designer for we can support it without any problem. Please try to close it under engine's name.
Qiangsheng, I wasn't able to find the UI to set the border thickness such as border-with to an absolute px value in the property editor but I can set it to 1px in the property sheet's "..." (not the property editor but the Eclipse built in one). It would be an enhancement to add similar setting dialog in property editor.
T.M. you can set the border width to 1px in table's propert sheet if you want to have it fix to 1 px in all output browsers. That's not the case. If user select thickness, user select a predefined border. That thickness defined in GUI is 1 px. And looks ie and mozilla have different definition.
If user set border to 1 px, that's another case. Property editor may need enhance to support input absolute border value. We can file another enhacement to support it. since different browser treat thin differently, so if the report is to have a 1px border, it should not use thin as the border thickness.
Change this bug to enhancement to add UI to set border width as absolute numbers such as 1px. or we can cancel this bug as invlid and log another enhancement. Consider to allow user input absolute value. Fixed it.Add some px choices in the width combo.

Bug.Summery: property bindings in data source get lost when importing from library
Bug.WithStack:
Added JDBC Driver URL and password property bindings to my data source in the library. Saved the library.
Opened the report with the data source, it didnt get the changes. So deleted the datasource from the report, and copied the new one into it from the library explorer (dong a refresh first). Checked the property bindings in the report - still missing. Tried again closing all files first, still no bindings.
had to manually copy in the bindings to every report. The reason looks like Model does not support it. Maybe model can't fix this bug. This bug is similar to datasource. When copy table or list which contains datasource , dataset or property bindings , just copy table or list without copying datasource ,dataset and property bindings.And maybe in library it is not very right to support property bindings , propery bindings is only useful in report design. We have reviewed this and concluded that this is an intended behavior of the Property Binding feature. Property binding is designed to "bind" or associate a data element with properties local to a report design (such as its report parameters). It is therefore always local to a report. It will not be copied together with the data set or data source when the data element is copied from one library/report to another.

Checked the property bindings in the report - still missing. Tried again closing all files first, still no bindings.
had to manually copy in the bindings to every report. The reason looks like Model does not support it. Maybe model can't fix this bug. This bug is similar to datasource. When copy table or list which contains datasource , dataset or property bindings , just copy table or list without copying datasource ,dataset and property bindings.And maybe in library it is not very right to support property bindings , propery bindings is only useful in report design. We have reviewed this and concluded that this is an intended behavior of the Property Binding feature. Property binding is designed to "bind" or associate a data element with properties local to a report design (such as its report parameters). It is therefore always local to a report. It will not be copied together with the data set or data source when the data element is copied from one library/report to another.

Bug.Summery: Eclipse doesn't shutdown when running providers inside
Bug.WithStack: I use ModelBus V1 and have a provider running inside of eclipse with the ModelBus V1 eclipse plug-in. I test this provider in a runtime workbench. When I have this provider started and I shutdown the runtime workbench I see that the workbench never stops, I have to terminate it manually. I have also seen that I cannot switch workspaces either, eclipse appears to shutdown but never re-initialises. I believe this is the same problem. I only get this problem when I start my provider. I have debugged my provider and it executes the plugin shutdown code which undeploys the adapter and then ends. What I do find though is that there is a thread running the simple axis server blocking on a server socket listen and it could be that because this thread cannot terminate it stops the whole of eclipse terminating. The bug is fixed. The updated version of Adapter is in the CVS This works for so, so register it as fixed
Bug.WithOutStack: I use ModelBus V1 and have a provider running inside of eclipse with the ModelBus V1 eclipse plug-in. I test this provider in a runtime workbench. When I have this provider started and I shutdown the runtime workbench I see that the workbench never stops, I have to terminate it manually. I have also seen that I cannot switch workspaces either, eclipse appears to shutdown but never re-initialises. I believe this is the same problem. I only get this problem when I start my provider. I have debugged my provider and it executes the plugin shutdown code which undeploys the adapter and then ends. What I do find though is that there is a thread running the simple axis server blocking on a server socket listen and it could be that because this thread cannot terminate it stops the whole of eclipse terminating. The bug is fixed. The updated version of Adapter is in the CVS This works for so, so register it as fixed

Bug.Summery: Code template inserts TABs when it should insert spaces
The SelectionTrackerAdapterFactory creates more than one ISelectionTracker per IWorkbenchPart
Bug.WithStack: If getAdapter(Object, Class) is called several times on an IWorkbenchPart the AdapterTrackerFactory attaches always a new ISelectionTracker to the IWorkbenchPart although its suppost to only attach one instance. This doesn't lead to unintentional behavior, it can lead to performance losses though. In principal the org.eclipse.core.runtime.ListenerList.add(Object) method should check if an identical listener is already presented. The comparison is done by identity and not by equality however. SelectionTrackerAdapterFactory has been removed Closing as part of mass query to clean up old resolved bugs in untargetted milestones.
Bug.WithOutStack: If getAdapter(Object, Class) is called several times on an IWorkbenchPart the AdapterTrackerFactory attaches always a new ISelectionTracker to the IWorkbenchPart although its suppost to only attach one instance. This doesn't lead to unintentional behavior, it can lead to performance losses though. In principal the org.eclipse.core.runtime.ListenerList.add(Object) method should check if an identical listener is already presented. The comparison is done by identity and not by equality however. SelectionTrackerAdapterFactory has been removed Closing as part of mass query to clean up old resolved bugs in untargetted milestones.

Bug.Summery: PersistenceOutline isn't set to an EmptyComposite when a WST XML editor is activated or brought to top
Bug.WithStack: The PersistenceOutline cannot display the content of a xml file and needs therefor to display an empty composite. This works fine unless an XML is opened inside a WST XML editor. An org.eclipse.wst.xml.ui.internal.tabletree.XMLMultiPageEditorPart XML editor doesn't trigger the activate or brought to top notification inside the ISelectionTracker because the IPartListener.partOpened(IWorkbenchPart) isn't called with the StructuredTextViewer obj. Fixed with refactored selection framework I am reopening this even though this is verified fixed for the xml editor. I see the same problem for the wst XSD editor meant to reopen, not verify as fixed Reproduced comment #2 in R1.0. Unable to reproduce these problems anymore. setting to fixed in M6

Bug.Summery: Sticky behavior for Chart Builder

Lines.Line: 1. Once user brought up the popup, to store the selection in current subtask and compond task.
2. If compound task selection is not null and existent in current subtask, to bring up the popup.
3. If compound task selection is not existent, to bring up the popup stored in the subtask.
4. If subtask selection is not existent either, do nothing.
- Open chart builder, go to a tab, open a docked popup, close the builder. Open
the builder: it goes back to the same tab, with the same popup active (if
available on the given chart)
- Open chart builder, go to format chart tab, open a docked popup. Click on
different node on the left tree, if the popup is also available here, leave it
open and refresh its content for the new node. For example clicking on X Axis,
Y Axis with Text Format popup open.
- Open chart builder, go to format chart tab. select a node in the tree, open a
dockup popup, go back to select data tab, go back to format chart tab: the last
selected node is still active and the popup is back.

Bug.WithStack:
It would help usability a lot if the chart builder was sticky:
- Open chart builder, go to a tab, open a docked popup, close the builder. Open the builder: it goes back to the same tab, with the same popup active (if available on the given chart) - Open chart builder, go to format chart tab, open a docked popup. Click on different node on the left tree, if the popup is also available here, leave it open and refresh its content for the new node. For example clicking on X Axis, Y Axis with Text Format popup open. - Open chart builder, go to format chart tab. select a node in the tree, open a dockup popup, go back to select data tab, go back to format chart tab: the last selected node is still active and the popup is back.
There might be some other scenarios, but that gives you the idea: make the user experience easier, you always expect things to be like you left them and not to be reset each time. This is particularly useful when you set similar properties on different elements (like font, or palette colors), or when you experiment some interactive properties and use report preview to fine-tume them(so the builder gets closed and opened multiple times) Added sticky behavior for subtask and popup selection, the logic is below: 1. Once user brought up the popup, to store the selection in current subtask and compond task. 2. If compound task selection is not null and existent in current subtask, to bring up the popup. 3. If compound task selection is not existent, to bring up the popup stored in the subtask. 4. If subtask selection is not existent either, do nothing.
Bug.WithOutStack:
It would help usability a lot if the chart builder was sticky:
- Open chart builder, go to a tab, open a docked popup, close the builder. Open the builder: it goes back to the same tab, with the same popup active (if available on the given chart) - Open chart builder, go to format chart tab, open a docked popup. Click on different node on the left tree, if the popup is also available here, leave it open and refresh its content for the new node. For example clicking on X Axis, Y Axis with Text Format popup open. - Open chart builder, go to format chart tab. select a node in the tree, open a dockup popup, go back to select data tab, go back to format chart tab: the last selected node is still active and the popup is back.
There might be some other scenarios, but that gives you the idea: make the user experience easier, you always expect things to be like you left them and not to be reset each time. This is particularly useful when you set similar properties on different elements (like font, or palette colors), or when you experiment some interactive properties and use report preview to fine-tume them(so the builder gets closed and opened multiple times) Added sticky behavior for subtask and popup selection, the logic is below: 1. Once user brought up the popup, to store the selection in current subtask and compond task. 2. If compound task selection is not null and existent in current subtask, to bring up the popup. 3. If compound task selection is not existent, to bring up the popup stored in the subtask. 4. If subtask selection is not existent either, do nothing.

Bug.Summery: [Presentations] changing tab order on "maximized" pane "restores" pane
Bug.WithStack:
On a maximized pane changing the tab order via drag & drop restores the pane, i.e. it gets back to normal size. This is really annoying, especially if in the restored pane some of the tabs are hidden (not enough space to show all tab headers in the pane). This makes it sometimes impossible to change the order as the tab, where the other one should be placed before or after has been hidden. Is this still a problem in 3.3?
PW
Changes requested on bug 193523 (In reply to comment #1) > Is this still a problem in 3.3?
Answering the old question from September: It's still an issue in 3.3.
Joerg

Bug.Summery: Add "Remember my server selection" checkbox
Bug.WithStack:
It would be really nice if the updater could "remember" what server I have selected in the past (either for all of my updates or for a particular plugin), or perhaps select/set a default mirror in the Update dialog, and/or be able to set and/or modify it in the Update Preferences. I guess it would be nice to start the update service (once I have the server(s) set) and come back a few minutes later and everything is done instead of having to wait and select a server by hand.
Thanks, Jim *** Bug 168293 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. *** The Eclipse Update component is no longer under development, and no longer exists in the Eclipse Platform 4.x stream. Bug.Summery: Project help
[Common Navigator] Sorters should be given access to a site as well
Bug.WithStack:
Content providers, label providers and action providers are all initialized with a site. The same does not seem to be true for sorters. My problem is this. I want to have a context menu that allwos the user to pick the sort order. I don't want the sort order to be a global setting so I would like to put in somewhere local to the view (like the IExtensionStateModel). I can put it there eazsily enough but, unfortunately, I don't see any easy way to access the sort order from the sorter. As a workaround, I think I will be able to find the sorter through the sorter service but a more direct method would be preferable. Currently the sorter implementations are not specialized; A change like this would require that (ICommonViewerSorter or CommonViewerSorter). Is this implicit in your proposal or is there another way that you think would make sense? It would also work if there was an easy way to get the sorter given a content extension id. I could then cast the sorter to my known sublcass and set any fields I need to. Note that to work around this I use used the INavigatorSorter#findSorter method. However, I had to really dig to get the right descriptor and had to make up some fake elements to pass to the find sorter method. A related issue is that the ICommonContentExtensionSite does not provide access to the INavigatorContentService. To make my workaround for this bug work, I had to cast to CommonExtensionSite which is internal. Granted, when the original problem is addressed, I probably won't need to access the service from my content provider but it may be generally helpful to make the content servive available off the content provider site. Is there sufficient reason that this should be released in 3.2.1 or is 3.3 okay? I have a workaround so 3.3 is fine.
+ Added ICommonContentExtensionSite.getService() : INavigatorContentService + Added INavigtatorContentService.getContentDescriptorById(String): INavigatorContentDescriptor + Added INavigatorSorterService.findAvailableSorters(INavigatorContentDescriptor) : Map <String(id), ViewerSorter>
There is a test in ProgrammaticOpenTest under navigator.tests that verifies the operation and correct behavior when no id is specified for the commonSorter (which is not required).
Fixed and released to HEAD.

Bug.Summery: JSR-170 Java Content Repository
Bug.WithStack:
We request that BIRT be enhanced to support a JSR-170 compliant Java Content Repository as a data source. See the following exchange, and feel free to contact me with any questions, comments, etc.
Rick,
One of the great things about open source is the opportunity to get a look at all the interesting new projects that are out there. JCR and Jackrabbit are new ones for me, but they look very promising.
BIRT has left the entire storage side of reports both for the report designs and report documents open, so there is no built in support for JCR or JSR-170.
If you could provide an enhancement request for JCR support we can look at adding it in a future BIRT release. We track enhancements in Bugzilla https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/enter_bug.cgi?product=BIRT.
Scott Rosenbaum BIRT PMC Looks like the bug reporter needs a new ODA data source which can support JSR-170 compliant Java Content Repository. If so, we need a lot of time to implement it for driver and UI, and then I put it into 2.1.0 final as temp target. Wenfeng, can you set its target? This is an enhancement in the web viewer/engine/design engine area. Need to define a URI for files/resources in a JSR 170 repository so that report engine can open report designsm report doc in it, load resources in it, and/or generate report doc in it. Wenfeng's interpretation in comment #3 is a separate feature. I think that the description and comment #1 are more accurate. I think he wants to run a query against a JSR-170 repository and then be able to use the metadata and content in a report.

We request that BIRT be enhanced to support a JSR-170 compliant Java Content Repository as a data source. See the following exchange, and feel free to contact me with any questions, comments, etc.
Rick,
One of the great things about open source is the opportunity to get a look at all the interesting new projects that are out there. JCR and Jackrabbit are new ones for me, but they look very promising.
BIRT has left the entire storage side of reports both for the report designs and report documents open, so there is no built in support for JCR or JSR-170.
If you could provide an enhancement request for JCR support we can look at adding it in a future BIRT release. We track enhancements in Bugzilla https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/enter_bug.cgi?product=BIRT.
Scott Rosenbaum BIRT PMC Looks like the bug reporter needs a new ODA data source which can support JSR-170 compliant Java Content Repository. If so, we need a lot of time to implement it for driver and UI, and then I put it into 2.1.0 final as temp target. Wenfeng, can you set its target? This is an enhancement in the web viewer/engine/design engine area. Need to define a URI for files/resources in a JSR 170 repository so that report engine can open report designsm report doc in it, load resources in it, and/or generate report doc in it. Wenfeng's interpretation in comment #3 is a separate feature. I think that the description and comment #1 are more accurate. I think he wants to run a query against a JSR-170 repository and then be able to use the metadata and content in a report.

Bug.Summery: [project explorer] Intermittent behaviour for double click on .java files

Lines.Line: a) double click still works in the package explorer
b) in project explorer, a .java can still be opened using the right click context menu
c) double click still causes the section associated with the .java to be expanded or collapsed.

Bug.WithStack:
In the project explorer only, double click on a .java file usually opens the file in an editor. Frequently, this doesn't work. Whether double click to open works or not seems to be determined when starting the IDE (launching eclipse.exe). Once the IDE is started double click will either work or not work for that session, the behaviour remaining unchanged until the IDE is closed and restarted.
When double click to open a .java file in the project explorer is not working: a) double click still works in the package explorer b) in project explorer, a .java can still be opened using the right click context menu c) double click still causes the section associated with the .java to be expanded or collapsed.
When double click to open a .java file is working, the file is both opened AND the section is expanded or collapsed. This is different to the package explorer where double click only opens the file and doesn't change the expaned/collapsed status of the section.
When restarting the IDE, it seems that double click fails more often if there are several editor windows left open, and works more often if all editor windows are closed. Sorry, first line should have read something like:
In the project explorer only, double click sometimes fails to open a .java file for editing. Not sure if this is relevant or not, but I'm seeing the following errors in the error log:
Error 2006-03-10 10:05:46.706 Warning: popupMenuId of "com.ibm.datatools.project.ui.projectExplorer" was overridden: old value = "com.ibm.datatools.project.ui.projectExplorer", new value = "com.ibm.datatools.project.ui.projectExplorer".
Added to the 1.0.2 hot list. Setting priority to p2, target to 1.0.2 M102 This is fixed and released for th WTP 1.0.2 032506 build. OK

Bug.Summery: JBoss 3.2.7 doesn't work with WTP 1.0.1
Bug.WithStack:
When I select JBoss 3.2.7 as new serever, there are messages about missing jars.
See also: http://www.eclipsezone.com/eclipse/forums/m91995726.html
Re: JBOSS 3.2.7 Integration with WTP1.x The bug is that v3.2.x should be renamed to 3.2.3, because JBoss 3.2.7 needs different server definition files.
So Eclipse only supports up to 3.2.3 and not 3.2.x.
In fact after updating to wtp 1.0.1 my JBoss 3.2.7 server was gone (again), till I reconfigured the server definition files.
Attached are my server definition files. Copy them into your eclipse/plugins/org.eclipse.jst.server.generic.serverdefinitions diretory after you made a backup of your old files.
Hope this helps.
Markus Kühn

Bug.Summery: Builder tray
Bug.WithStack:
I've written a tool that monitors build process (handles email notifications, may parse rss feeds) and shows build status in system tray (icon is added for each build type; green led means build is ok, red means failed). It's written in java and uses swt to provide ui.
Currently I've placed it in technology/org.eclipse.gmf/devtools/org.eclipse.releng.builder.tray but I'd like to contribute it to releng project so others could notice and use it. Hi Dave,
This isn't really a releng project per say but rather bucket for the platform releng builds. If you want to contribute something to a common releng project, I would suggest contact Nick Boldt of EMF who is working on a common build infrastructure for the modeling projects. Bug.Summery: [IDE] Misleading error message that workspace is currently in use

Lines.Line: 1. workspace exists and is already in use
2. directory cannot be created

Bug.WithStack:
3.2M5 I currently moved to a new PC which had different drive letters. I start up one Eclipse instance, and then in there run a second instance under the debugger. In the launch configuration I still had the old path name to my workspace, like "D:\workspace". But that's not right anymore (everything is on C:). So when I tried to launch the second instance (Run > Debug...) I got an error dialog, but the message was misleading. It said:
"Workspace Cannot be Locked Could not launch the product because the associated workspace is currently in use."
It's not in use, it's completely missing. Also it would be nice for it to tell me what workspace directory it was complaining about since I have several. this message comes from the IDE. The "Workspace in use" is generally unfriendly and could be improved to give the user more info about how to resolve the problem including a hint that there may be another instance of Eclipse running. Created attachment 47014 org.eclipse.ui.ide patch Fixed by distinguishing between two possible failures to launch: 1. workspace exists and is already in use 2. directory cannot be created
Also fixed up the messages to make the wording consistent.
Boris, please review/release. Thanks. Patch released to HEAD >20060730. Thanks Wassim!

Bug.Summery: Remove killer.cpp and killer.h
Bug.WithStack: Remove killer.cpp and killer.h as these functions were added early on to support killing processes in Windows 98/ME and NT. They are no longer needed for 2000 and XP due to better Java support in this area. This has been done.
Bug.WithOutStack: Remove killer.cpp and killer.h as these functions were added early on to support killing processes in Windows 98/ME and NT. They are no longer needed for 2000 and XP due to better Java support in this area. This has been done.

Bug.Summery: [Help] Searching for actual hits only still shows potential hit label
Bug.WithStack: If you set preference to only show actual search hits (as opposed to all potential hits), those actual hits that had filters still show up with the potential hit label and grayed out state in the UI. Need to check whether we're showing potential hits or not and turn this presentation off when only showing actual hits, since they really are actual hits. Fixed.
Bug.WithOutStack: If you set preference to only show actual search hits (as opposed to all potential hits), those actual hits that had filters still show up with the potential hit label and grayed out state in the UI. Need to check whether we're showing potential hits or not and turn this presentation off when only showing actual hits, since they really are actual hits. Fixed.

Bug.Summery: Masterpage background problem: white border visible in HTML

Lines.Line: 1. I tried using the masterpage backgound color --> no effect
2. I tried to use the predefined 'report' style, background-color --> does not appear in style_0, and so it has no effect on the page neither

Bug.WithStack:
Hello,
I have a report where I set a background color (light green) in the masterpage. In PDF output the background color is ok, shared all over the page. But in HTML format there appears a white border (left side, top side, right side) and in the bottom a big white area. (see attachment birt.jpg)
How can I achieve that the whole webbpage appears in light green (like in PDF output) without any whiteborder?
I tried also to use the predefined CSS style 'report', and the background-color attribute. But it seems to have no effect neither.
Furter investigations have shown me, that te predefined CSS-style 'report' leads into a style_0 in the reports HTML source. So I did furter tests:
If I change e.g. the 'font-familiy' format within the 'report' style then I see an immediate effect on the font-family format within style_0 of the source of the HTML page. But if I change the 'background-color' format within the 'report' style and preview my report, nothing happens. If I look into the HTML source again, I expect to see a 'background-color:' format within style_0, but it is'nt there!?! Why it is not there?
So how can I get rid of this white border arround my chart?
1. I tried using the masterpage backgound color --> no effect 2. I tried to use the predefined 'report' style, background-color --> does not appear in style_0, and so it has no effect on the page neither
So any ideas? Created attachment 36060 HTML result within browser (IE), with the white border This border is caused by the js code. JS currently tries to put page content from engine into a div created in the viewing time to make sure the master page content can be completely shown in the browser window without being blocked by a vertical scroll bar.
We could remove it if this cause user big problem. (In reply to comment #2)
Hello Jun Zhai,
the div is not the problem, the content can appear in a div! the superior element (body) and its CSS style_0 is the problem. An easy way to solve this problem is I already mentioned in my post:
Modifications of the predefined CSS style 'report' lead into modifications in style_0 of the HTML source of the report. (correct me if I am wrong)
I saved the HTML source of the report into a file and added background-color: #FF0000 manually to the style_0 within the HTML source, then the border disappears. So style_0 is the right place to act on, because id morifies the body tag of the HTML page. The problem is, in the chart wizard I can modify the CSS style 'report' (which is style_0 in the result page) but only on font style. If I modify the font, it changes accordingly in the style_0. But for the backround style it does not! In the style_0 no background-color: appears even if I set it under the chart wizard! This is the problem! So just make the chart wizard overtaking all changes in the predifiend CSS style 'reports' into the style_0 of the report result, thats it!
See attachment birt1.jpg, there you can see the result of changes on the 'Font' style has an effect on style_0
See attachment birt2.jpg, there you can see, same wizard same style ('report'), changes in the 'Background' style has no effect on style_0, no backround-color: is there!!!
Created attachment 36230 CSS style 'reports': Modification of Font style has effect on style_0 Created attachment 36231 CSS style 'reports': Modification of Backround style has NO effect on style_0!!! please evaluate the suggested solution from T.M. if it can not be done in 2.1.0, please schedule to 2.1.1. Hello Wenfeng Li,
whats the status of this bug now? Any improvement visible? Thanks for information! fixed Has been fixed. I think the reporter needs to make four white borders disappear intead of the bottom white border (In reply to comment #9) > Has been fixed.
Hello Wei Yan,
I am back to BIRT now (using version 2.1.2), after a while working on other projects. Now I wanted to create a new report, but I still have this border problem. You said it is fixed already. May you can explain where I can change the settings to get rid of this white border?
Thanks a lot! (In reply to comment #11)
Hello? Nobody out there???
*** Bug 168827 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. *** The white border user seen is the default margin of the body. In html the body has a default margin. We should remove it.
I have fix it in the preview modle in both BIRT 2.1.3 and 2.2. Viewer team will fix it in the run & frameset model.
Remove the padding value for DIV container when use run & frameset servlet pattern. Hello,
maybe one of you (Jerry Cheng or Liang Yu) can explain me, what your comments mean? Do I get you right that it will be fixed in version 2.1.3?
Why Wei Yan (on 2006-06-17 20:53:50) wrote it is fixed, if it is not?
If it will be fixed in 2.1.3 do I have to change some settings in the reports to make the border disappear or is it set to no more visible by default?
Thanks for further information!
Hi, burns:
This bug has been fixed in BIRT 2.1.3 and 2.2 on 2007-04-18.
You can download current version BIRT 2.1.3 and open your report without changing any setting. The white border should disappear.
Thanks. (In reply to comment #17)
Where can I download the version 2.1.3? I can only find 2.1.2 and 2.2M6.
Can you provide a link to a version where this problem is solved?
Thanks a lot! BIRT 2.1.3 isn't released yet. You can check it using the Nightly build. For example the following link:
http://download.eclipse.org/birt/downloads/build.php?build=N-R1-2.1.3-N20070426-200704260600
Also you can open the recent build page.

Bug.Summery: Packager gets bad baseLocation from previously run tasks
Bug.WithStack:
If during the same ant script we run a fetch or generate task followed by the package task, the value of the BuildTimeSiteFactory's static installedBaseLocation remains unchanged as the package task does not set that variable.
This means that the site for the packaging can point to an unrelated directory, if that directory no longer exists, we get an exception with "Content Provider not set for Site". It is also conceivable that this base location could contribute unexpected versions of plugins to the packaging. Created attachment 36075 patch
Set the static BuildTimeSiteFactory installed base site to null in the packager task Patch released in HEAD.
Bug.WithOutStack:
If during the same ant script we run a fetch or generate task followed by the package task, the value of the BuildTimeSiteFactory's static installedBaseLocation remains unchanged as the package task does not set that variable.
This means that the site for the packaging can point to an unrelated directory, if that directory no longer exists, we get an exception with "Content Provider not set for Site". It is also conceivable that this base location could contribute unexpected versions of plugins to the packaging. Created attachment 36075 patch
Set the static BuildTimeSiteFactory installed base site to null in the packager task Patch released in HEAD.

Bug.Summery: Add dynamic probekit support with IAC
Bug.WithStack: This request comes from a downstream product who wants to make use of the dynamic instrumentation to monitor applications running in the workspace. The requirement is to be able to run the probes without having to install the RAC Raising severity and priority of defect. All of our other analysis types work with IAC and probekit shouldn't be an exception. Waiting for Hubert to make the changes described in bug#140663 Verified on TPTP-4.2.0-200605031400 on Windows and Linux. Only supported platforms are Windows, Linux, and Solaris. Bug.Summery: Cannot rename and add a launch configuration to the favourites list at the same time
Bug.WithStack:
Locate the External Tools drop down button, and open up the External Tools dialog. Create a new launch configuration (doesn't matter which type), and open up the Common tab. In the Display in Favourites Menu section, select the External Tools option. Without hitting apply, rename your launch configuration. Now, save and exit the page. Click on your external tools drop down menu again, and your launch configuration will not be on the menu (and it should be). Select the Organize Favourites option, and on the ensuing dialog, your launch configuration is not listed.
I ran into this problem while implementing a patch for Bug 80447.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 74002 ***

Locate the External Tools drop down button, and open up the External Tools dialog. Create a new launch configuration (doesn't matter which type), and open up the Common tab. I ran into this problem while implementing a patch for Bug 80447.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 74002 ***

Bug.Summery: [Viewers] Compare uses wrong content type for project nature-based content types registered for same file extension
Bug.WithStack:
I have two content types that are defined in two different plugins as follows:
In PluginA: <extension point="org.eclipse.core.runtime.contentTypes"> <content-type base-type="org.eclipse.core.runtime.text" file-extensions="ss,s,inc" id="contentTypeA" name="%name" priority="high"> </content-type> </extension>
PluginB: <extension point="org.eclipse.core.runtime.contentTypes"> <content-type base-type="org.eclipse.core.runtime.text" file-extensions="ss,s,inc" id="contentTypeB" name="%name" priority="high"> </content-type> </extension>
Now, I bind these content types to two different natures like so:
In PluginA: <extension id="ProjectNatureA" name="Project Nature A" point="org.eclipse.core.resources.natures"> <runtime> <run class="my.package.ProjectNatureA"/> </runtime> <content-type id="plugin.A.contentTypeA"/> </extension>
In PluginB: <extension id="ProjectNatureB" name="Project Nature B" point="org.eclipse.core.resources.natures"> <runtime> <run class="my.package.ProjectNatureB"/> </runtime> <content-type id="plugin.B.contentTypeB"/> </extension>
This all works fine when opening and editing files. The same filename ending in ".ss" is opened by the appropriate editor based on the nature of the project. Now, I have set up content merge viewers, and they fail to work. It appears that it registers the content-types based on file extension only, ignoring natures, so there is only ever one content-type registered for the extension ".ss". Thus, the wrong compare viewer is opened. I have registered my compare viewers as follows:
In PluginA: <extension point="org.eclipse.compare.contentMergeViewers"> <viewer class="my.package.ContentViewerCreatorA" id="myContentViewerCreatorA"> </viewer> <contentTypeBinding contentMergeViewerId="plugin.A.myContentViewerCreatorA" contentTypeId="plugin.A.contentTypeA"/> </extension>
In PluginB: <extension point="org.eclipse.compare.contentMergeViewers"> <viewer class="my.package.ContentViewerCreatorB" id="myContentViewerCreatorB"> </viewer> <contentTypeBinding contentMergeViewerId="plugin.B.myContentViewerCreatorB" contentTypeId="plugin.B.contentTypeB"/> </extension>
I find that it is always opening the content merge viewer for plugin B. I'm assuming it rips through all extensions and overrides the merge viewer already registered by plugin A on the ".ss" extension, with the one found for plugin B on the same extension. Why is it being registered on the file extension anyway, and not queried at runtime with IFile.getContentDescriptor().getContentType().? We should have a look at this for 3.3. We didn't have time to address this in 3.3. Mass update - removing 3.4 target. This was one of the bugs marked for investigation (and potential fixing) in 3.4 but we ran out of time. Please ping on the bug if fixing it would be really important for 3.4, and does not require API changes or feature work. You're now able to switch to a different content merge viewer if the default one doesn't fit you.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of bug 201116 ***

Bug.Summery: Pull up refactoring allows pulling fields into an interface
Profiling monitor multiple agent terminate...
Bug.WithStack:
When two instances of a Perfmon Agent are launched and terminated one after the other, the second agent to be terminated does not seem to terminate correctly. The process terminates, but the profiling monitor does not refresh correctly (instead of the agent appearing terminated, it continues to appear as though it is being monitored).
This seems to be due to the agent proxy continuing to have an active state set to true (and not to false as it should be once it is terminated).
I've traced the issue to what I think is the TRCAgentProxy agentProxy = PDCoreUtil.getCorrespondingAgent(fProcess,ag,true);
call in org.eclipse.hyades.trace.ui.internal.piclient.PIProcessListener:250 in the agentInactive(Agent a) method. The getCorrespondingAgent method returns null for the erroneous agent, with
agentProxy.getRuntimeId() == ag.getUUID() (PDCoreUtil.java: 307)
resolving to false incorrectly. Since RuntimeId and UUID are both strings, it appears as though this should be an object comparison (.equals()) instead.
I have not been able to figure out why the first agent launched matches with the == statement, and the second does not. Hi George, are you running the two agent under the same process tree? Can you verify if the process and the listener being invoked is the correct one? Hey Eugene,
The two agents are under separate process trees. I've debugged the getCorrespondingAgent method to show what I'm seeing.
There are two agents running, under different processes. When I terminate the first, the output looks as follows:
Searcing for corresponding agent in TRCProcessProxy (name=Windows System, pid=2508) Searching for agent with UUID of 82cf46d2-4497-4b15-af08-f3783526b1ec (hashcode=-1973141163)
Comparing PerfmonAgent to PerfmonAgent ... true Comparing runtime IDs agentProxy.getRuntimeId()=82cf46d2-4497-4b15-af08-f3783526b1ec ag.getUUID()=82cf46d2-4497-4b15-af08-f3783526b1ec ... true
So, a match was found since the agentProxy.getRuntimeId() and ag.getUUID() matched.
When I try and terminate the second agent, it all seems correct except that there is no strict match.
Searcing for corresponding agent in TRCProcessProxy (name=Windows System, pid=3212) Searching for agent with UUID of d31e432f-4a7d-4a5a-bcad-32a620028882 (hashcode=257780671)
Comparing PerfmonAgent to PerfmonAgent ... true Comparing runtime IDs agentProxy.getRuntimeId()=d31e432f-4a7d-4a5a-bcad-32a620028882 ag.getUUID()=d31e432f-4a7d-4a5a-bcad-32a620028882 ... false
Even though the IDs are exact there is no match since they are not stored in the same string (ie, this is not a content comparison).
The process is the correct one (the process is actually terminated) and the PIProcessListeners seem to be correct as well (that is, they reference the correct agent). Created attachment 36527 patch Eugene,
Please apply the patch. patch submitted As of TPTP 4.6.0, TPTP is in maintenance mode and focusing on improving quality by resolving relevant enhancements/defects and increasing test coverage through test creation, automation, Build Verification Tests (BVTs), and expanded run-time execution. As part of the TPTP Bugzilla housecleaning process (see http://wiki.eclipse.org/Bugzilla_Housecleaning_Processes), this enhancement/defect is verified/closed by the Project Lead since this enhancement/defect has been resolved and unverified for more than 1 year and considered to be fixed. If this enhancement/defect is still unresolved and reproducible in the latest TPTP release (http://www.eclipse.org/tptp/home/downloads/), please re-open.

Bug.Summery: Need build setup for Java 5 profiling (JVMTI)
Bug.WithStack: The JVMTI component is getting ready to be shipped as a Tech Prev. Need build support for build setup. Hubert, Randy Let me know the effort estimate. I will send an invite to discuss this next week (March 13-06). Thanks, Guru Moving to I3 as code contribution to JVMTI component is pending EMO legal approval. We're close to integrating these into the builds. However, there are still things to do with packaging, building with what we have available to us in the build process, etc. Will be checking in fixed makefiles that are at least syntactically correct right away, but there is still more to do. Checking in 6 configure-environment.jvmti.sf files for the Windows|Linux X IA32|IPF|EM64T native platforms. Setting JAVA_HOME using BEA's JRockit for Java 5 and including $JAVA_HOME/bin in the path. Retargeting for completion in i4. configure-environment.jvmti.sf files for Windows|Linux X IA32|IPF|EM64T, and add necessary features to build_ia.sh in releng/master/bash. Build after agntctrl built, and push out agntctrl.sdk for each platform prior to build. Note that since jvmti depends on probekit sources, we can't just push jvmti.runtime package, but have to push the whole tptp.nativecode to get both packages. Overkill, but necessary if we can't change the structure of the jvmti build. Bug.Summery: Notification of elapsed estimate time
Bug.WithStack: It would be useful to receive a toaster notification when the elapsed time on a task exceeds the estimated time. That way if a task is turning into a time sink, the user is notified and can re-evaluate the task in terms of cost/benefit/priority etc.. That's a GREAT idea.
Bug.WithOutStack: It would be useful to receive a toaster notification when the elapsed time on a task exceeds the estimated time. That way if a task is turning into a time sink, the user is notified and can re-evaluate the task in terms of cost/benefit/priority etc.. That's a GREAT idea.

Bug.Summery: Error message if not driver templates installed
Bug.WithStack: If the driver management preference page is opened in a platform (e.g. RCP) where no driver templates are contributed, an error message saying that the preference page contains invalid values appears. Would rather just see an empty templates list. Brian: This should be an easy fix. It is important for RCP applications. Delivered fix today for this issue. Verified and closing.

Bug.Summery: [Reconcile] Preserve user-modified values for attributes with model-coded defaults
Bug.WithStack:
Some reconciling strategy should be implemented like it is done for standard EMF GenModel. Created attachment 36070 Initial simple implementation of the fix for subj
The patch assumes that there are empty org.eclipse.gmf.codegen.reconciler and org.eclipse.gmf.codegen.reconciler.test.taipan plugins already created somewhere Attributes mostly often modified by user (like plugin id, provider name, ...) should be preserved.
Comment on attachment 36070 Initial simple implementation of the fix for subj
Proposed patch provides base extensible reconciler service. However, in the current service implementation, only small subset of features are supported. It will be extended in future Created attachment 36071 Fixed: reconciler fails to load old gmfgen resource when invoked from UI There are attributes in gmfgen that are not set during transformation step and get their values from handcoded implementation. It's easy to detect user changes for such attributes, hence the patch.
Next attributes were identified as suitable for reconciling: Copyright text Package prefix Diagram file extension Same diagram/model file attribute Plugin provider name Plugin version
Please reopen scr to add more. refactored into oeg.common/oeg.internal.common.reconcile package. Tests: CodegenReconcileTest. [GMF Restructure] Bug 319140 : product GMF and component Generation was the original product and component for this bug

I am not sure iff this counts as an eclipse problem, or if PMD is at fault. It's a bug in PMDPlugin. THe API being called, IResource.setPersistentProperty, is spec'd to say the property should be under 2KB in length. That's the restriction that is being hit in this stack trace. I suggest reporting the bug to the maintainer of that plugin.

Bug.Summery: Support proper annotation removal
Bug.WithStack:
The column annotation is not removed when setting the column back to the default selection through the UI.
Another removal issue involves OrderBy, where currently the annotation cannot be removed once it is added. In this case the annotation can stand alone, or not be used at all. For this case a check-box would likely be needed to determine if the user wants the annotation in the source or not.
Annotation removal needs to be reviewed across the plug-in. The first item in this bug appears to be resolved. Was fixed in 0.5, not really valid for 1.0. Closing as fixed.
Bug.WithOutStack:
The column annotation is not removed when setting the column back to the default selection through the UI.
Another removal issue involves OrderBy, where currently the annotation cannot be removed once it is added. In this case the annotation can stand alone, or not be used at all. For this case a check-box would likely be needed to determine if the user wants the annotation in the source or not.
Annotation removal needs to be reviewed across the plug-in. The first item in this bug appears to be resolved. Was fixed in 0.5, not really valid for 1.0. Closing as fixed.

Bug.Summery: org.eclipse.eclipsemonkey should export the javascript packages

source_code.code: // equivalent to: params = new Object(); params.title="hello"; etc...

Bug.WithStack:
I'm wanting to write a DOM that has access to the JavaScript packages; to do this right, eclipsemonkey should re-export these packages. Or perhaps better, it should split the javascript packages off into a separate javascript bundle. We're not sure why you want this - could you explain the problem you are trying to solve? I have a DOM implementation which itself is invoking some JavaScript code. And potentially (probably) returning JavaScript objects through the DOM back into the .em script.
To make this work right, it really needs to be using the SAME instance of the JavaScript runtime as Eclipse Monkey. If I use my own Javascript library, I get class loading issues (as would be expected).
I don't think there's a way around having "org.mozilla.javascript" added to the "Export-Package" entry of "org.eclipse.eclipsemonkey". I thought perhaps I could create a fragment of your plugin which re-exported the package, but that doesn't appear to work. I posted some info on my blog about what I was trying to do:
http://pmuellr.blogspot.com/2006/03/more-eclipse-monkeying.html Created attachment 36262 JavaScript plug in
This plug-in contains the Rhino JavaScript implementation. All packages are exported. Created attachment 36263 Patch for org.eclipse.eclipsemonkey to refactor out JavaScript library. I've got a slightly different use-case which requires the same fix. I've been writing a few test DOMs and wanted to pass a javascript object as a parameter object (useful for optional arguments), e.g.
var params = {title: "hello", title: "world"}; // equivalent to: params = new Object(); params.title="hello"; etc... myDom.display(params);
To enable this to work my dom needs to have a method signature similar to:
public void display(ScriptableObject params)
Unfortunately I can't do this because ScriptableObject has not been re-exported. This means I have no way to access the slots of the js prototype object.
I've verified that the proposed fix will work, though I only need the package: "org.mozilla.javascript" at present. If you look at Wayne's comments and the attachments, you might guess that the way the situation was going to be fixed was to break Rhino into a separate plugin that eclipsemonkey and whomever else wanted, could pre-req. That's the story I heard a few weeks ago anyway.
Should work for me, and should work for Dave also. Patch sort of applied (I changed the name of the plugin to org.mozilla.rhino instead of .javascript). Closing.

I'm wanting to write a DOM that has access to the JavaScript packages; to do this right, eclipsemonkey should re-export these packages. I don't think there's a way around having "org.mozilla.javascript" added to the "Export-Package" entry of "org.eclipse.eclipsemonkey". I thought perhaps I could create a fragment of your plugin which re-exported the package, but that doesn't appear to work. I posted some info on my blog about what I was trying to do:

This plug-in contains the Rhino JavaScript implementation. All packages are exported. Created attachment 36263 Patch for org.eclipse.eclipsemonkey to refactor out JavaScript library. I've been writing a few test DOMs and wanted to pass a javascript object as a parameter object (useful for optional arguments), e.g.

Bug.Summery: bugzilla task change notifications via toaster
Bug.WithStack:
In order to make the user aware of incoming changes to Bugzilla items in their task list, a Bugzilla change notification should appear in the mylar notification dialog. This notification should contain the identity of the bug and the change that has taken place. Space is limited so the layout/format of this information is critical.
As part of this report, improvements must be made to the synchronization mechanism to reduce CPU load. Suggested starting points: reducing the priority of the scheduled synchronization jobs, don't synchronize tasks that already have incoming status (they will get synchronized when the user opens them anyway).
Related bugs: bug#124908 Why would you do that? I think it would be more consistent with Eclipse proress visualization if you just leave jobs on progress view and provide hyperlink to task list. E.g. see cvs synchroization... The intention here is to minimize reliance on email by providing a non-intrusive notification. Notification will only occur if a change in the report occurs (not a notification for every synchronization). Then, if the user finds the notification interesting, they can click on it and the related issue is displayed, just like reminder notifications currently work. Does this answer your question or have I misunderstood? Rob, this is another one we need to round out the functionality and should be easy to add at this point. Created attachment 45439 mylar/context/zip
context for incoming notifications etc Could you make the completion of a synch job trigger a reminder check? These things are really useful...

Bug.Summery: Adding a plugin to a feature enters wrong version
Bug.WithStack: In eclipse build I20060209, create a plugin project. The Overview in the plugin.xml shows the version 1.0.0. Now create a feature project without adding any plugins in the wizard. After the feature is created and the feature.xml is opened, go to the Plug-ins tab and click the Add... button. Select the plugin just created. The plugin name (0.0.0) is entered into the plugin list in the feature.xml. The version should be 1.0.0, not 0.0.0. 0.0.0 is a special notation and recommended as it solves real issues. see bug 92508 for details.
Bug.WithOutStack: In eclipse build I20060209, create a plugin project. The Overview in the plugin.xml shows the version 1.0.0. Now create a feature project without adding any plugins in the wizard. After the feature is created and the feature.xml is opened, go to the Plug-ins tab and click the Add... button. Select the plugin just created. The plugin name (0.0.0) is entered into the plugin list in the feature.xml. The version should be 1.0.0, not 0.0.0. 0.0.0 is a special notation and recommended as it solves real issues. see bug 92508 for details.

Bug.Summery: J2EE Module Dependencies (de)select all does not work
Bug.WithStack:
When adding J2EE Module Dependencies to a Dynamic Web Project, the "Select All" and "Deselect All" buttons do not function. They appear to check the JAR/Module but that selection does not persist.
A simple work-around is to individually check each JAR/Module.
I'm using the WTP 1.0.1 all-in-one download.
Thanks! -Rob I could not reproduce it in WTP 1.5 03_23 build, please re open if you see it in WTP 1.5 verified, not an issue.

When adding J2EE Module Dependencies to a Dynamic Web Project, the "Select All" and "Deselect All" buttons do not function. They appear to check the JAR/Module but that selection does not persist.

Bug.Summery: Standalone GMFGraph generator: Optionally generate separate GMFGrpah instance containing the same set of diagram elements but pointing to the custom figures
Bug.WithStack:

Bug.Summery: [Tests] Check generated figures against originating gmfgraph model

Lines.Line: 1. manifest.mfjet - activator needs singleton=true option?

2. Is there a real need in getFigureXCheck? Smells like code duplication, and what's really being checked is that code in figureXCheck() is aligned with code in figureX(). Can't it be done in bit more generic way? With graphdef.Figure instance you've got all the information you need to actually check IFigure instance.
3. Custom Figures as part of oeg.tests plug-in. Again, what's the need for that? What if we just generate these figures into separate plugin first, and then reference them from that plugin?
1. It does not NEED this. However it seems that all of our plugis has this flag.
2. It is TESTS code. I see a lot of other ways to implement this.

E.g, create abstract class GMFFeatureChecker with 5+ implementation classes that know, say, that feature Color should be checked via some Color-specific way different from the check for, say Dimension features. Then I may create one more separate registry class which will map feature name into checker and traverse gmf-EOBject reflectively while checking generated instances against feature values.
OR
I may use new and exciting generative approach and generate tests using 5+ per-feature templates and 2 classes that compose them together.

But, I am absolutely sure that in this case someone will mind that we really need 7 new classes/templates (which we will have to maintain, _test_, etc) just to implement simple checks that may be done by just 4 simple methods.

So, I am in in trouble. In addition, I do not see a lot of code duplication there. The only common features that are checked by more than 1 FigureCheck is a children.size(). I doubt that we want to traverse ALL OF OTHER OF OUR TESTS and extract the code which checks the size of collection into separate helper code. Could you please point me to code duplication except this one?

3. We want to check that custom figures (that are just a peaces of legacy user code) may be used. This use casediffers from the one suggested (also we need to test the suggested use case, but it is the part of another scr) Please consider these 2 classes as just a legacy code.
1. There should be REASON not to have singleton. All other plug-in has singleton=true for reason, not because it's just a 'fancy' thing

2. Code duplication is in figureX() and checkFigureX() methods. Latter relies on the code in the former. If you change figureX, you have to change checkFigureX. If you are unlucky, and checkFigureX was not updated but didn't failed, you won't ever notice the problem. That's why it's benefitial to have 'veryfy' login independent from the code under check

3. What't the problem treating classes just generated as part of previous test as 'legacy' code. What's the point to have them coded (provided we trust our generated code - we do check it with our tests, right?)
(In reply to comment #5)
> 'veryfy' login independent from the code under check
"logic", of course
Created attachment 36891
Contains subj tests (reflective version) as well as fixes required to make them pass.

Bug.Summery: [Memory View] AddMemoryBlockAction and GoToAddressAction should get debug context from service
Bug.WithStack:
The actions get current debug context by getting selection from the Debug View. They should get current debug context from the debug context service instead. Also looks at all references to the debug view in actions and Memory View. Make sure debug context is retreived from DebugUIToos#getDebugContext(). Debug context changes are detected by listening to events from Debug Context Manager.
Fixed in:
AddMemoryBlockAction AddMemoryRenderingAction GotoAddressAction RetargetAddMemoryBlockAction AddMemoryRenderingActionDelegate AbstractMemoryViewPane RenderingViewPane MemoryBlocksTreeviewPane Darin, please verify. Thx Sam Made further fix to RenderingViewPane. #contextActivated needs to empty the view if the selection is not valid. Verified.
Bug.WithOutStack:
The actions get current debug context by getting selection from the Debug View. They should get current debug context from the debug context service instead. Also looks at all references to the debug view in actions and Memory View. Make sure debug context is retreived from DebugUIToos#getDebugContext(). Debug context changes are detected by listening to events from Debug Context Manager.
Fixed in:
AddMemoryBlockAction AddMemoryRenderingAction GotoAddressAction RetargetAddMemoryBlockAction AddMemoryRenderingActionDelegate AbstractMemoryViewPane RenderingViewPane MemoryBlocksTreeviewPane Darin, please verify. Thx Sam Made further fix to RenderingViewPane. #contextActivated needs to empty the view if the selection is not valid. Verified.

Bug.Summery: [Import/Export] import project from zip cannot locate projects

2. delete project and contents
3. Import existing project again from temp.zip
BUG: project doesn't appear in list because their is an exception that the zip file is closed

Bug.WithStack:
1. Import existing project from temp.zip 2. delete project and contents 3. Import existing project again from temp.zip BUG: project doesn't appear in list because their is an exception that the zip file is closed
This doesn't seem to be a problem for .tar files. I think this is happening because the zip file is cached in the import structure provider. The zip file remained open after the import was fininshed but as a result of fixing bug 115360, the zip file is now closed. Bug.Summery: File writing is not thread safe in the org.eclipse.hyades.logging.core plug-in.
Bug.WithStack:
File writing is not thread safe in the org.eclipse.hyades.logging.core plug-in.
There are several instances in the org.eclipse.hyades.logging.core plug-in where file writing is not thread safe. These instances should be corrected (e.g. file locking) if the negative performance impact can be absorbed, new thread safe APIs created or the lack of threading issue well documented in the current APIs. Transitioning to new component owner (Cindy Jin). Cannot contain in TPTP V4.3(i3) This is required from AC perspective. In TPTP 4.3, some of the classes in org.eclipse.hyades.logging.core were moved to a new plugin called org.eclipse.tptp.platform.logging.events. Therefore, I believe this bugzilla affects the following classes and methods:
In org.eclipse.hyades.logging.core plugin: The File versions of org.eclipse.hyades.logging.core.XMLUtility.serialize org.eclipse.hyades.logging.core.XMLUtility.deserialize
In org.eclipse.tptp.platform.logging.events plugin: The File versions of src.cbe101/org.eclipse.hyades.logging.events.cbe.util.EventFormatter.associationEnginesFromCanonicalXMLDoc src.cbe101/org.eclipse.hyades.logging.events.cbe.util.EventFormatter.eventsFromCanonicalXMLDoc
src.events/org.eclipse.tptp.logging.events.cbe.util.EventFormatter.associationEnginesFromCanonicalXMLDoc src.events/org.eclipse.tptp.logging.events.cbe.util.EventFormatter.eventsFromCanonicalXMLDoc
Paul, can you please confirm this list. (In reply to comment #4)
This list is correct, in addition to file operations in:
org.eclipse.hyades.logging.commons.FileLogger.java (org.eclipse.hyades.logging.core)
The affected code is no longer supported by the commiter community and all change requests are being closed. If you are impacted or feel strongly otherwise, please reopen the bugzilla with comments and suggestions for follow up action. Closing.

Linux Debian

Bug.Summery: Verbose mode of the ant adapter should be a real verbose mode
Bug.WithStack: Right now the log file is created using the verbose option of the javac ant task. This should be removed and the build script should set the log file name using a compilerarg nested element. The verbose mode should then enable the verbose mode of the batch compiler. Created attachment 36078 Proposed fix Fixed and released in HEAD. Verified for 3.2 M6 using build I20060328-0010
Bug.WithOutStack: Right now the log file is created using the verbose option of the javac ant task. This should be removed and the build script should set the log file name using a compilerarg nested element. The verbose mode should then enable the verbose mode of the batch compiler. Created attachment 36078 Proposed fix Fixed and released in HEAD. Verified for 3.2 M6 using build I20060328-0010

Bug.Summery: Create overlay images on the fly
Bug.WithStack:
Please refer to http://www.eclipse.org/newsportal/article.php?id=15811&group=eclipse.tools.emf#15811 Created attachment 36072 Patch for emf.edit and emf.edit.ui against build_200603090000 This patch can be tested with every model. Just insert the following to the ctor of an editor:
editingDomain.getResourceSet().eAdapters().add(new CreateChildImageOverlayer());
*** Bug 114657 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. *** Created attachment 36246 Alternative approach
This attachment does something similar. (Hopefully the .gif wont't be corrupted; I couldn't pull it from your patch.) Ed,
Yes, the gif is corrupted too! In general your patch seems to work. From looking at the code, I had the feeling that it acts as a fallback solution when the generated gifs are not found (some Exception occurs). But when testing it, it works for all images - even if the generated gifs are present. No problem for me, but...
Your approach has the advantage that it is simpler and that it works for all editors.
My proposal has the advantage that it offers a general possibility to compute arbitrary images on the fly. I don't need this feature.
After all I'd be happy if either one of both approaches makes it to HEAD ;-)
One last question: Your generated image is not cached, too? (In reply to comment #5) > From looking at the code, I had the > feeling that it acts as a fallback solution when the generated gifs are not > found (some Exception occurs). But when testing it, it works for all images - > even if the generated gifs are present. No problem for me, but...
That's not true! It doesn't find the gifs in derived models and thatwas one of the reasons to make this patch ;-) Ed,
I fear there is another issue with your approach: How can I disable generation of only the CreateChild images? Eike,
Sorry, I wasn't on the CC list so I didn't notice all these appends.
Creating the factory used by the editor like this:
new ComposedAdapterFactory(ComposedAdapterFactory.Registry.INSTANCE)
should automatically find each registered adapter factory appropriate for a particular model.

Bug.Summery: Related to bug 131373, the build script should set up the log file name inside a compiler argument
Bug.WithStack:
The build script should set up the log file name using a compilerarg nested element in the javac ant task instead of using the verbose mode. See bug 131373. The corresponding compilerarg nested element should set up its compiler name in order to prevent javac from being called with this option that it doesn't support. Doing this would remove a hack from the ant adapter. We need to synchronize our changes. Veronika, you would need to update all custom builds. Created attachment 36077 Proposed fix Created attachment 36082 New patch
I tested it on jdt.core Created attachment 36083 Last patch
The previous patch would not set the log file if no compiler args were required. This is fixed now. Patch released in HEAD. What do I need to change in the SWT custom scripts? Created attachment 36149 patch for org.eclipse.swt.win32.win32.x86
I have attatched a patch for the changes required to the SWT windows fragment. A similar patch must be created for all SWT fragments. Note: the build.xml for org.eclipse.swt does not call javac so it does not need to change. [contributed patch applied]

Bug.Summery: Don't use Eclipse install directory for default extension location
Bug.WithStack:
By default, the update manager currently (3.2M5) offers to install a new add-in feature directly in the Eclipse installation directory. You can change it but most naive users will accept the default. This is NOT a best practice because if you have to re-install Eclipse then you lose the features and plug-ins. This has frustrated many a new Eclipse user.
This is a request to change the default extension location used by the update manager. For example if Eclipse is installed into "C:\Program Files\Eclipse" then suggest a different place, for example "C:\Program Files\Eclipse Extensions" or maybe "C:\Documents and Settings\userid\Eclipse Extensions".
On Unix, if the install directory is "/usr/local/lib/eclipse" then the extension location could be "/usr/local/lib/eclipse-extensions" or perhaps "~/eclipse-extensions".
I don't care too much where you default it as long as it's NOT in the main Eclipse install tree. In fact if the user tries to install a plug-in in the main Eclipse installation directory I would like to see a warning dialog come up telling them it's not a good idea because it will be lost if Eclipse is reinstalled. All for this function - +1. This topic was touched on in the 2nd comment in bug 106185. The goal there was to allow a product to somehow control where new extensions get added by the update manager.
This was also discussed moons ago in the mailing list in several ways: http://dev.eclipse.org/mhonarc/lists/platform-update-dev/msg00580.html http://dev.eclipse.org/mhonarc/lists/platform-update-dev/msg00472.html
The net of that discussion led some tool/private domains to use a placeholder feature and the required use of the colocation-affinity attribute in additional features; this is not all joy as it still allows the eclipse root dir to be the default and that causes problems long term. +1 and as a related note, the install/update UI always suggest the last extension install location as default, which is not great when you are trying to get cleanly separated extensions . Check new integration builds, UM will default to the most recently used installation site. As for initial default there is no other site that is guaranteed to exist and on some platforms there might not be anything else at all. This is the only logical thing. We also made installation directory now more prominent and easier to change. Users need to have some responsibilities. Those that do not care will not care anyways those that do have an option to easily change. The Eclipse Update component is no longer under development, and no longer exists in the Eclipse Platform 4.x stream. If this problem still occurs in Eclipse Platform 4.2 or later, please enter a new bug report against Equinox p2.

Bug.Summery: Add support for an "aggressive start" list

Lines.Line: - make jobs and registry lazy-start

- persisting the state so we know whether or not a bundle was started lazily or by someone calling its #start method. So next time we start up, we can start up the bundles that were explicitly started.

Bug.WithStack:
Related to bug 126649 which involves removing update.configurator's dependancy on the runtime.
We would like to add support for another key in the config.ini which contains a list of bundle symbolic names. The update configurator will process this list and if it happens to install a bundle on the list, then it will start it.
I will work on this and attach a patch to this report. Created attachment 36171 patch for update.configurator
Patch for the update.configurator project.
Added property "eclipse.eagerStart" to the config.ini file. Value is a comma-separated list of bundle symbolic names to agressively start.
I applied the patch for this bug as well as the patch for bug 126649, modified my config.ini so it only had update.configurator and common on the osgi.bundles list, added org.eclipse.core.runtime to the eclipse.eagerStart list, and the workbench started ok.
Note that I also had to set Eclipse-Lazystart:true for the registry plug-in but I think this is what we want, right? ok, this isn't working for me anymore. I will update the patch once I figured out what I messed up. :-)
John, what are your thoughts on making the jobs bundle lazy-start? Are there problems with this? The org.eclipse.core.runtime bundle does not handle when things it depends on are not started. In the current osgi.bundles list we make sure org.eclipse.core.jobs and org.eclipse.equinox.registry are started before org.eclipse.core.runtime is started. This is done by having core.jobs and equinox.registry startlevels at 2 and core.runtime's startlevel at 3.
If we stick all three of these bundles (core.jobs, equinox.registry and core.runtime) on the "aggressive start" list then they will all endup with the same startlevel. The OSGi spec states that if bundles are at the same startlevel then they will be started by install order. Update configurator will install these bundles in alphabetical order. So they will be started in the following order
org.eclipse.core.jobs org.eclipse.core.runtime org.eclipse.equinox.registry
This order is problematic because runtime does not start successfully (gets NPEs) when the registry is not available. Given that we have almost no time left I suggest we make core.jobs and equinox.registry lazy start.
I think this is the desired behavior for both bundles because their API will not function correctly unless they are started. You may argue that jobs does not really require being started, but if it is not started then it will fail to log properly (requires PackageAdmin service) and it will not execute any shutdown code when the platform is shutdown.
One issue may be that jobs will be shutdown at a different time. Currently it is at startlevel 2 which causes it to be one of the last bundles to stop. If it is lazy started and it is at the same startlevel as the rest of the bundles then it will be stopped according to dependency order. This should cause it to be stopped after all bundles which depend on it are stopped. I think this is desired behavior but it is a change from before where we ensured jobs was stopped last because of startlevel. We are going to look at doing a couple of things:
- make jobs and registry lazy-start - persisting the state so we know whether or not a bundle was started lazily or by someone calling its #start method. So next time we start up, we can start up the bundles that were explicitly started.
This has been deferred to post-3.2. This is a mass update of Platform Update bugs that have had no activity in three years. Platform Update was replaced in Eclipse 3.4 (2008) by a new provisioning system called Equinox p2. If this bug or enhancement is not already addressed in p2 please enter a new bug report against p2 (RT > Equinox > p2). If you still want to see this bug addressed in the deprecated Platform Update component, please reopen this bug. Patches welcome.

Bug.Summery: JET whitespace stripping around tags is incorrect

Lines.Line: 1) defines whitespace stripping as the removal of leading and trailing whitespace (including the trailing new-line) from a tag that is alone on a line.

2) allow tag declarations to include an attribute indicating whether whitespace stripping should occur. In general, tags that do not write content to the should enable white space stripping, while others should not.

Bug.WithStack:
JET attempts to strip whitespace around tags, but the current implementation yeilds inconsistent results.
A better solution includes:
1) defines whitespace stripping as the removal of leading and trailing whitespace (including the trailing new-line) from a tag that is alone on a line.
2) allow tag declarations to include an attribute indicating whether whitespace stripping should occur. In general, tags that do not write content to the should enable white space stripping, while others should not.
Also, consider the possibility of escaping a new-line, and of normalizing (in the XML sense) content. The use-case for this is something like:
<c:set select="..." name="getterSignature"> <c:get select=".../@getterName"/>( <c:iterate ".../arg" var="arg" delimiter=", "> <c:get select="$arg/@type"/> <c:get select="$arg/@name> </c:iterate> </c:set>
Currently, this must be squished into a single, very long line of code, but the above is much more readable. Changes committed to CVS. Fixed in build 1.0.0 I200603231121. Move to verified as per bug 206558.

Bug.Summery: Expose the ImportManager used by <java:importsLocation>
Bug.WithStack:
If the import manager used by the importsLocation tag is exposed by public API, then it can be shared with other custom tags that generate Java Class references.
So, instead of
<java:import><mycustom:foobar ... /></java:import>
the custom tag alone could be used:
<mycustom:foobar ... />
provided the implementation of foobar accessed the import manager created by importsLocation. Changes committed to CVS Fixed in build I200603161025. Move to verified as per bug 206558.
Bug.WithOutStack:
If the import manager used by the importsLocation tag is exposed by public API, then it can be shared with other custom tags that generate Java Class references.
So, instead of

the custom tag alone could be used:
